intro: Plectronia neilgherrensis, commonly known as the Himalayan plectronia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, often at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
